poem:
**Unfamiliar Skies**

In the metal bird's belly,  
a wingless terror took flight;  
a violation of the quiet night.  
Land-bound justice,  
clipped by lines on a map,  
flounders,  
as a sleeping soul cries out,  
unheard amidst  
a sky without borders.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Woman sexually assaulted on flight challenges UK rules on compensation A woman who was sexually assaulted while sleeping on a flight to London is challenging UK government rules that disqualify her from a compensation scheme because the plane was not registered in Britain. She was attacked on a Qatar Airways flight from Doha, Qatar, to Gatwick in September last year. Momade Jussab, 66, of Feltham, was sitting next to her and put his hands down". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
